name: Hampton Inn & Suites Pensacola I-10 North at University Town Plaza

reviews.text: We have stayed at Hampton Inns across the country and this is one of the better properties. We were in town for graduation at Naval OCS and chose the property for its proximity to the Pensacola Naval Air Station. In truth, the 11 miles or so to the station is a long haul with an endless array of traffic lights. Plan on 30 minutes or longer! This is a newer property, which was full while we were there (March 8 - 10, 2006). The breakfast area is very spacious so that there is not a "crush" in the morning. Rather than serving the generic fruit of "melon cubes", packed in an odd tasting "whatever", found at so many Hampton Inns, this site offers fresh segments of oranges & grapefruits. The layout of the food items is very spacious. One does not have to "rub elbows" with one's fellow travellers. As we finished breakfast, one of the staff offered us small boxes of mints. What a nice touch! On our second morning we left at 4:45 a.m. to participate in the 5:25 a.m. morning run at naval OCS. The breakfast go bags were waiting at the desk for early departures. I wish this had been the case in San Francisco when we had an early flight to catch. This is a well managed property
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.text: New hotel so it is clean and fresh. Staff are great: helpful, responsive, friendly. Only negative: no food within walking distance except for food court at mall.
reviews.title: Great new hotel
nice motel
reviews.text: stayed at the new hampton inn in pensacola from Aug 28th to Sept. 3rd. Since this was only around 35 days old, it was very nice, rooms are alittle small but very clean. You get maid service every morning and nice breakfast. Not alot of hot items just ordinary things, bagels,toast,doughnuts etc. I travel to pensacola often and will stay here again as there are alot of dirty motels in the area.
OVERVIEW: Found this to be a convenient and friendly location. Not particularly close to the tourist or beach areas, but I was just passing through so this was fine.
reviews.title: Good, solid hotel choice, not near tourist areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: Off of the 10 freeway and behind a mall, this is a really low-key area. If you're looking to be close to the historic areas or the beach, this is not the right place for you. If that's not your aim, this is a safe and sensible location.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOTEL: Newer property in a cluster of similar hotel chains. Standard Hampton Inn look-feel with the usual breakfast area, pool and fitness room. The service I received was excellent from beginning to end. They mainly get business-week traffic, so my Friday stay was very quiet and uncrowded.
reviews.title: Take my advise choice another hotel

likes.disliked: — Reception Staff and you could hear next door speak through the walls

reviews.text: ROOM: Standard Hampton Inn room (#325) with everything you need. I liked the bottle of water and granola bar that were left for me as a complimentary welcome. Very clean, well-maintained with a large bathroom. TV had more channels than I normally see, which was nice. Free internet worked great.
reviews.title: Excellent Hampton

reviews.text: RECOMMENDATIONS: If you're coming to Pensacola for a holiday or time at the beach, this is not for you. If you're passing through or on a business trip, you'll love this place - it's got what you need and the service was great.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Hampton Inn

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this Hampton and had a really good experience. I am always nervous about booking a hotel without seeing it first hand. We have two children and I want it to be safe and clean. Tripadvisor was extremely helpful. Although it is hard to go wrong with a Hamton, you still have to be careful and make sure you ask questions. The beds were very comfortable. Our room was very clean and the quiet. I also like the breakfast in the morning. Last, we noticed that they also offer to go breakfast, served in a brown bag. We thought that was nice too. I will stay at Hampton again.
reviews.title: Loved our stay
Loved it!
reviews.text: We recently had a great stay at the Pensacola Hampton Inn. The Hampton beds were great and so was everything else. One employee was especially helpful ... Suzanna ... she went way above and beyond the call of duty and we greatly appreciated it. We would DEFINITELY stay there again.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn for three nights. After trying two other Pensacola hotels that were filthy and noisy, we found this hotel room to be exceptionally clean and a wondeful place to catch up on our rest. The staff there was very friendly and helpful as we were new to Pensacola. The breakfast was great with lots of choices. We also enjoyed the free internet service that allowed us to contact our family members back home! We were also able to wash our laundry there. This is an excellent place to stay!!!! We strongly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Haven of rest

reviews.text: We stayed at this Hampton Inn for one night, and we were very impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. We've visited Pensacola many times in the past, and this is by far the best hotel we've found. The hotel is very new and is spotless. Breakfast was great with hot eggs, sausages, pastries, cereal, oatmeal and fruit. I like strong coffee, and there was a "Robust" blend (among others) available.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: This Hampton is not only a new facility, but the the best hotel around. I travel alot
reviews.title: Best Hampton around

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Pensacola-University Mall Hotel
description: Our Hampton Inn & Suites Pensacola-University Mall hotel boasts an ideal location in the charming coastal village and thriving resort of Pensacola, Florida. Minutes from our hotel in Pensacola, Florida, you can explore Gulf Islands National Seashore, Pensacola Beach, and over fifty miles of pristine white shores. Enjoy a warm welcome and friendly service at our hotel in Pensacola, Florida and start your day right with Hampton's free hot breakfast and famous waffles. Catch up with work in our free business center or host a meeting or gathering for up to 30 people in our meeting space. Work out in our fitness center, enjoy a refreshing swim in our outdoor pool or visit the beautiful sandy shores of Pensacola Beach. Retire to a comfy guest room featuring an HDTV and free high-speed wireless internet access and get some rest on a clean and fresh Hampton bed®.
